page.title: 03Tourism - North West Wight
page.content: Yarmouth is one of the main ferry points from which visitors travel to and from the I.O.W. When a ferry docks at Yarmouth ,particularly during the summer months, the roads heading eastwards through our prescribed area are very busy aithough they are narrow and in some cases contain rather sharp bends. Most cars we found took to the northermost route to Newport. Few seemed to stop in Yarmouth with its narrow streets and one-way traffic system. On the northern edge -near the coast- the council have provided two parking areas which overlook the Solent.People can watch the boats pass by.They are very popular with local residents as well as visitors. There are no parking charges.
